text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the 'applicable law test' under section 3, titled 'The applicable law question: can a state counterclaim be based on purely domestic environmental law?'. It explains that tribunals consider whether the counterclaim is grounded in obligations applicable to the investor under domestic law (incorporated via the treaty's applicable law clause or the arbitration agreement) and discusses the leading cases (Burlington, Perenco) where counterclaims grounded in domestic environmental law were upheld, contrasting this with situations where the applicable law clause is treaty-only. This directly satisfies the requirement of explaining the applicable law test.", "criterion_id": "47ddb755-e7f6-4ead-a8aa-80db8a87a3b9"}
